buildingblocks.name: Merchant Account
buildingblocks.summary: Creation, management and integration with merchant accounts that are required to process credit cards.
buildingblocks.details: Creation, management and integration with merchant accounts that are required to process credit cards.

buildingblocks.name: Bank Account
buildingblocks.summary: Integration with existing bank accounts, for linking with payment workflows.
buildingblocks.details: Integration with existing bank accounts, for linking with payment workflows.

buildingblocks.name: Processor / Gateways
buildingblocks.summary: Access to multiple payent processors and gateways in multiple countries.
buildingblocks.details: Access to multiple payent processors and gateways in multiple countries.

buildingblocks.name: Currencies
buildingblocks.summary: Ability to conduct transactions in multiple currencies, handling all the conversions for developers.
buildingblocks.details: Ability to conduct transactions in multiple currencies, handling all the conversions for developers.

buildingblocks.name: Credit Card Transactions
buildingblocks.summary: The option to process major credit cards.
buildingblocks.details: The option to process major credit cards.

buildingblocks.name: ACH Transactions
buildingblocks.summary: The option to process transactions over the ACH network.
buildingblocks.details: The option to process transactions over the ACH network.

buildingblocks.name: Checks / Wire Transactions
buildingblocks.summary: The option to do bank to bank, wire and check transactions.
buildingblocks.details: The option to do bank to bank, wire and check transactions.

buildingblocks.name: Cash Transactions
buildingblocks.summary: The option to accept cash payments at retail locations.
buildingblocks.details: The option to accept cash payments at retail locations.

buildingblocks.name: Virtual Transactions
buildingblocks.summary: The option to accept transactions for credits via virtual accounts.
buildingblocks.details: The option to accept transactions for credits via virtual accounts.

buildingblocks.name: Aggregate Transactions
buildingblocks.summary: Tools for performing multiple transactions at once.
buildingblocks.details: Tools for performing multiple transactions at once.

buildingblocks.name: Credit Card Reader
buildingblocks.summary: A physical credit card reading device.
buildingblocks.details: A physical credit card reading device.

buildingblocks.name: Credit Card Scan / Picture
buildingblocks.summary: A mobile phone scan or picture of a credit card.
buildingblocks.details: A mobile phone scan or picture of a credit card.

buildingblocks.name: One Click / One Touch / Instant Buy
buildingblocks.summary: The ability to enable single action transaction
buildingblocks.details: The ability to enable single action transaction
buildingblocks.category: One Click / One Touch / Instant Buy

buildingblocks.name: Recurring Payments
buildingblocks.summary: The ability to perform recurring or subscription based transactions.
buildingblocks.details: The ability to perform recurring or subscription based transactions.

buildingblocks.name: Pre-Payments
buildingblocks.summary: The ability to setup payment(s) prior to designated payment date.
buildingblocks.details: The ability to setup payment(s) prior to designated payment date.

buildingblocks.name: Metered Payments
buildingblocks.summary: Payments based upon some metered usage of a resource.
buildingblocks.details: Payments based upon some metered usage of a resource.

buildingblocks.name: Estimates
buildingblocks.summary: Estimations of payments, with payment handling at designated time.
buildingblocks.details: Estimations of payments, with payment handling at designated time.

buildingblocks.name: Invoices
buildingblocks.summary: Physical or online invoicing of customers as request for payment.
buildingblocks.details: Physical or online invoicing of customers as request for payment.

buildingblocks.name: Mobile Billing
buildingblocks.summary: The ability to perform transaction against mobile users monthly phone bill.
buildingblocks.details: The ability to perform transaction against mobile users monthly phone bill.

buildingblocks.name: Social Payments
buildingblocks.summary: An option for making and accepting payments via social platforms like Facebook and Twitter.
buildingblocks.details: An option for making and accepting payments via social platforms like Facebook and Twitter.

buildingblocks.name: Email Payments
buildingblocks.summary: Tools for sending and receiving transactions via email.
buildingblocks.details: Tools for sending and receiving transactions via email.

buildingblocks.name: SMS Payments
buildingblocks.summary: Tools for sending and receiving transactions via SMS.
buildingblocks.details: Tools for sending and receiving transactions via SMS.

buildingblocks.name: Carts
buildingblocks.summary: Ready to go online shopping cart solutions to support payment services.
buildingblocks.details: Ready to go online shopping cart solutions to support payment services.

buildingblocks.name: Checkout
buildingblocks.summary: Ready to go checkout pages, to support payment services.
buildingblocks.details: Ready to go checkout pages, to support payment services.

buildingblocks.name: Forms
buildingblocks.summary: Embeddable HTML and JavaScript forms to conduct transactions.
buildingblocks.details: Embeddable HTML and JavaScript forms to conduct transactions.

buildingblocks.name: Buttons
buildingblocks.summary: Embeddable HTML and JavaScript buttons to initiate transactions.
buildingblocks.details: Embeddable HTML and JavaScript buttons to initiate transactions.

buildingblocks.name: Marketplace
buildingblocks.summary: The ability to facilitate marketplace style transactions between sellers and vendors.
buildingblocks.details: The ability to facilitate marketplace style transactions between sellers and vendors.

buildingblocks.name: Fraud Protection
buildingblocks.summary: Tools and services that assist developers in preventing payment fraud.
buildingblocks.details: Tools and services that assist developers in preventing payment fraud.

buildingblocks.name: PCI Compliance
buildingblocks.summary: Tools and services that help developers achieve PCI compliance.
buildingblocks.details: Tools and services that help developers achieve PCI compliance.

buildingblocks.name: Encryption
buildingblocks.summary: Providing necessary encryption tools and services to protect communications.
buildingblocks.details: Providing necessary encryption tools and services to protect communications.

buildingblocks.name: Sandbox
buildingblocks.summary: A safe environment for developers to develop applications against, ensuring quality of service in production environments.
buildingblocks.details: A safe environment for developers to develop applications against, ensuring quality of service in production environments.

buildingblocks.name: Webhooks
buildingblocks.summary: Registering of developer provider URLs for making HTTP calls when specific events occur.
buildingblocks.details: Registering of developer provider URLs for making HTTP calls when specific events occur.

buildingblocks.name: Push Notifications
buildingblocks.summary: A push notification framework for developers to use when delivering push features in their applications.
buildingblocks.details: A push notification framework for developers to use when delivering push features in their applications.

buildingblocks.name: Barcodes
buildingblocks.summary: The ability to generate barcodes that represent potential physical or virtual transactions.
buildingblocks.details: The ability to generate barcodes that represent potential physical or virtual transactions.

buildingblocks.name: Products
buildingblocks.summary: Separate systems for managing products that transactions will include.
buildingblocks.details: Separate systems for managing products that transactions will include.

buildingblocks.name: Orders
buildingblocks.summary: Separate systems for managing orders in which transactions support.
buildingblocks.details: Separate systems for managing orders in which transactions support.

buildingblocks.name: Customers
buildingblocks.summary: Separate systems for managing customers who make transactions.
buildingblocks.details: Separate systems for managing customers who make transactions.

buildingblocks.name: Coupons
buildingblocks.summary: Separate systems that issue coupons which can be applied against transactions and affect the balance.
buildingblocks.details: Separate systems that issue coupons which can be applied against transactions and affect the balance.

buildingblocks.name: Loyalty
buildingblocks.summary: Separate systems for managing customer loyalty programs.
buildingblocks.details: Separate systems for managing customer loyalty programs.

buildingblocks.name: Expenses
buildingblocks.summary: Separate systems or managing expenses that involve transactions.
buildingblocks.details: Separate systems or managing expenses that involve transactions.

buildingblocks.name: Time Tracking
buildingblocks.summary: Separate systems for tracking time associated with transactions.
buildingblocks.details: Separate systems for tracking time associated with transactions.

buildingblocks.name: Cards
buildingblocks.summary: The ability to issue physical or virtual gift, membership and other types of cards.
buildingblocks.details: The ability to issue physical or virtual gift, membership and other types of cards.

buildingblocks.name: JS Libraries
buildingblocks.summary: Supporting Javascript libraries that provide embeddable integration with payment services.
buildingblocks.details: Supporting Javascript libraries that provide embeddable integration with payment services.

buildingblocks.name: Mobile SDKs
buildingblocks.summary: Supporting mobile SDKs for iOS, Android, Windows and others, to facilitate mobile payments.
buildingblocks.details: Supporting mobile SDKs for iOS, Android, Windows and others, to facilitate mobile payments.

buildingblocks.name: On-Premise
buildingblocks.summary: The ability to deploy payment services on-premise, keeping transaction local.
buildingblocks.details: The ability to deploy payment services on-premise, keeping transaction local.

buildingblocks.name: Cloud
buildingblocks.summary: The ability to deploy payment services in the clouds, with centralized security.
buildingblocks.details: The ability to deploy payment services in the clouds, with centralized security.

buildingblocks.name: 3rd Party Shopping Carts
buildingblocks.summary: Integration options for popular 3rd party shopping carts.
buildingblocks.details: Integration options for popular 3rd party shopping carts.

buildingblocks.name: Platform as a Service (PaaS) Integration
buildingblocks.summary: Integration with popular PaaS platforms like Salesforce and Amazon.
buildingblocks.details: Integration with popular PaaS platforms like Salesforce and Amazon.

buildingblocks.name: Frameworks
buildingblocks.summary: Integration with popular programming frameworks like Backbone and Angular.
buildingblocks.details: Integration with popular programming frameworks like Backbone and Angular.

buildingblocks.name: Automation
buildingblocks.summary: Integration with popular API automation platforms like Zapier and IFTTT.
buildingblocks.details: Integration with popular API automation platforms like Zapier and IFTTT.

buildingblocks.name: Educational Access
buildingblocks.summary: Educational access is about making resources available to students, and the academic insttutions they attend. Academic pricing allows students to put resources to work, gain a familiarity with services, without having to pay regular fees.
buildingblocks.details: Educational access is about making resources available to students, and the academic insttutions they attend. Academic pricing allows students to put resources to work, gain a familiarity with services, without having to pay regular fees.

buildingblocks.name: Free
buildingblocks.summary: A popular way to provide access to an API, is by offering a free tier so that anyone can sign up, start using an API and understand the value an API delivers. This allows consumers to kick the tires, see if it will meet their needs before spending money.
buildingblocks.details: A popular way to provide access to an API, is by offering a free tier so that anyone can sign up, start using an API and understand the value an API delivers. This allows consumers to kick the tires, see if it will meet their needs before spending money.

buildingblocks.name: Free Trial
buildingblocks.summary: Rather than just free for an unknown amount of time, so API providers are providing the ability to test drive an API for a period of time, then you have to pay. Usually this is associated with some sort of SaaS business model.
buildingblocks.details: Rather than just free for an unknown amount of time, so API providers are providing the ability to test drive an API for a period of time, then you have to pay. Usually this is associated with some sort of SaaS business model.

buildingblocks.name: Freemium
buildingblocks.summary: Providing a relief for free users, allowing them to upgrade to a paid account, usuallky part of a tiered approach to pricing. Freemium starts as free, allowing users to kick the tires, but once they begin to depend on they can begin paying for the service.
buildingblocks.details: Providing a relief for free users, allowing them to upgrade to a paid account, usuallky part of a tiered approach to pricing. Freemium starts as free, allowing users to kick the tires, but once they begin to depend on they can begin paying for the service.

buildingblocks.name: Not For Profit
buildingblocks.summary: It is not just Sillicon Valley startups doing APIs, non-profit organizations, and government agencies are doing APIs, and the monetization strategy is not all about making money.
buildingblocks.details: It is not just Sillicon Valley startups doing APIs, non-profit organizations, and government agencies are doing APIs, and the monetization strategy is not all about making money.

buildingblocks.name: Request Pricing
buildingblocks.summary: Services that require a user pays, but does not have pricing listed directly on the site, and users must request a quote for pricing on single or all API access.
buildingblocks.details: Services that require a user pays, but does not have pricing listed directly on the site, and users must request a quote for pricing on single or all API access.

buildingblocks.name: Buy Credits
buildingblocks.summary: You haveh to buy credits, charge your user accounts with funds from PayPal, bank account, or credit card before you can exceed basic API rate limits.
buildingblocks.details: You haveh to buy credits, charge your user accounts with funds from PayPal, bank account, or credit card before you can exceed basic API rate limits.

buildingblocks.name: Volume Pricing
buildingblocks.summary: Providing additional layers of pricing based upon volume purchases, allowing users to better understand their API usage and potentially buy in bulk based upon their past habits.
buildingblocks.details: Providing additional layers of pricing based upon volume purchases, allowing users to better understand their API usage and potentially buy in bulk based upon their past habits.

buildingblocks.name: Pay as You Go
buildingblocks.summary: Allowing API consumer to pay as they go, accumulating a monthly bill, or possibly prepaying on their account. Either way they are able to pay for what they us of API resources, as they use it.
buildingblocks.details: Allowing API consumer to pay as they go, accumulating a monthly bill, or possibly prepaying on their account. Either way they are able to pay for what they us of API resources, as they use it.

buildingblocks.name: Tiered
buildingblocks.summary: Providing multiple tiers of paid access, such as bronze, gold or platinum. Each tier has its own set or services and allowances for access to API resources. With pricing, stepping up in cost for each tier
buildingblocks.details: Providing multiple tiers of paid access, such as bronze, gold or platinum. Each tier has its own set or services and allowances for access to API resources. With pricing, stepping up in cost for each tier

buildingblocks.name: Unit Based
buildingblocks.summary: When pricing is based upon individually define units of value made available via an API. This could be per API call, storage on disk, message, or any other pre-defined unit of measurement.
buildingblocks.details: When pricing is based upon individually define units of value made available via an API. This could be per API call, storage on disk, message, or any other pre-defined unit of measurement.

buildingblocks.name: Enterprise Pricing
buildingblocks.summary: Enterprise is a broad term to describe pricing that is part of a larger sales process, and a common way for large companies to price products and services based upon a customers need, and information extracted through sales cycles.
buildingblocks.details: Enterprise is a broad term to describe pricing that is part of a larger sales process, and a common way for large companies to price products and services based upon a customers need, and information extracted through sales cycles.

buildingblocks.name: Marketing Vehicle
buildingblocks.summary: APIs can provide an excellent marketing vehicle for a company and its online presence. Through sensible branding strategies, developers can become 3rd party marketing agents, working on behalf of a core company and its b
buildingblocks.details: APIs can provide an excellent marketing vehicle for a company and its online presence. Through sensible branding strategies, developers can become 3rd party marketing agents, working on behalf of a core company and its b

buildingblocks.name: Traffic Generation
buildingblocks.summary: APIs can also be used to drive traffic to an existing website or applicaiton. By desigining an API to use hyperlinks directed at central websites or apps, and encouraging consumers to build their own websites and apps that are integrated with the API, the opportunity for driving traffic to other sites is very desireable to many companies who are providing APIs.
buildingblocks.details: APIs can also be used to drive traffic to an existing website or applicaiton. By desigining an API to use hyperlinks directed at central websites or apps, and encouraging consumers to build their own websites and apps that are integrated with the API, the opportunity for driving traffic to other sites is very desireable to many companies who are providing APIs.

buildingblocks.name: Brand Awareness
buildingblocks.summary: As a new tool in an overall marketing and branding strategy, an API can provide a type type of brand exposure via 3rd party websites and applications. Extending the reach of a brand, using 3rd party API consumers as the engine.
buildingblocks.details: As a new tool in an overall marketing and branding strategy, an API can provide a type type of brand exposure via 3rd party websites and applications. Extending the reach of a brand, using 3rd party API consumers as the engine.

buildingblocks.name: Content Acquisition
buildingblocks.summary: Content acquisition is when a platform uses APIs to enable the adding, updating, and deleting of content for the purpose of employing users to generate content for a core platform.
buildingblocks.details: Content acquisition is when a platform uses APIs to enable the adding, updating, and deleting of content for the purpose of employing users to generate content for a core platform.

buildingblocks.name: SaaS
buildingblocks.summary: Software as a Service (SaaS) has become a common approach to selling software online to consumers and businesses. Often times an API will compliment the core software and its offering, providing value to SaaS users. API access is often included as part of core SaaS platform, but also can be delivered as an upsell for premium SaaS users.
buildingblocks.details: Software as a Service (SaaS) has become a common approach to selling software online to consumers and businesses. Often times an API will compliment the core software and its offering, providing value to SaaS users. API access is often included as part of core SaaS platform, but also can be delivered as an upsell for premium SaaS users.
